medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after eating grilled chicken the previous night, accompanied by epigastric abdominal pain and heartburn. The patient had nausea and non-bilious vomiting the next morning. A similar episode occurred after eating a large hotdog, which was resolved by vomiting. There was belching, flatus, and bowel movements throughout the episode. In the emergency department, symptoms resolved with pain medication.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mild sleep disordered breathing by recent sleep study, recommendation for CPAP not pursued, mild cholesterol not on medication, fatty liver by recent ultrasound, and iron deficiency anemia.
medical_history.family_history: Obesity and a maternal aunt who died of obstructive sleep apnea.
